doc.text: Sorry Whatsapp but I voiced my concerns via mail and had no feedback. I will now have some control over my contacts and privacy....and its free! No more lack of privacy and I can now pic my contacts with out having to block any one of my contacts. Thanks BlackBerry. Sort out the privacy then I might be prepared to pay for your app like you are wanting. 1. The ability to hide my last on-line time stamp. 2. Being able to select who I want to be able to see that I have whatsapp. 3. An on/off function. Sort that out and I will recommend the app till then its BBM for me.

doc.title: Love it
doc.text: Superior to SMS in every way: faster, easier to use, feature rich. I can send a text, voice, video or photo in same convo thread. There are built in "emoji" so I don't need to install something extra. And no more group SMS conversations that get mangled cause some people use different OS. My only desire is to have more android widgets for this app.

doc.title: Connection Error!
doc.text: This is super cool and me number one application , HOWEVER :Today i get some update , it claims that i should restart the phone in order to work properly after the update . When i did that when i switch the phone on i got something like " whatsapp fail to do something but updating security policy may resolve the problem" . Then i saw a "shield" icon on my upper left screen wich says to update security policy . When i press "update" button it shows "connecting to server" and after a while , something like 10 to 15 seconds it says "Unsucssessful due to connection error". I tryed while on "E"-edge / H+ and while hooked on wi-fi and still it says connection error when i got perfect connection and access to internet and everything revolved with connection super fast ! Now can someone please explain me what is this about and is it important to update it or i can simply press the button " do not show for the next 30 days " instead of update button the next time it shows that security update is needed ?

doc.title: Password protect & Permission
doc.text: Dear Team, Congrats for the entire team for making such a useful and user friendly app. I have a suggestion to have password protection for the app and also try to ask permission if some unknown sends message or add us in a group. Now there is no control for us and anyone can add us into any group. Please consider this as a serious issue and sure this will be an addon feature and majority will like this. Thanks.

doc.text: Best cross platform IM app I've ever used, bar none. Free for 1st year, only USD1.99/yr thereafter is peanuts. Wish attachment limit is 20MB vs 12MB though. Although WhatsApp says that tablets aren't supported, two friends of mine using Samsung Galaxy Tabs (one on Froyo, the other on Honeycomb) were able to install and use WhatsApp on their devices. My HTC Flyer 3G on a custom Honeycomb ROM however, will not run WhatsApp. Hope the software devs will get WhatsApp to run on tablets soon.

doc.title: Gudmrng ✅ Hello, I. Am PURV director of whatsapp, this message is to inform ...
doc.text: Gudmrng ✅ Hello, I. Am PURV director of whatsapp, this message is to inform all of our users that we have only 530 accounts available for new phones, and that our servers have recently been very congested, so we asking for your help to solve this problem. We need our active users to forward this message to every single person in your contact list in order to confirm our active users that use WhatsApp, if you do not send this message to all your contacts to WhatsApp, then your account will remain inactive with the consequence of losing all your contacts. The automatic update symbol on your SmartPhone, appear with the transmission of this message. Your smartphone will be updated within 24 hours.

doc.title: DESERVES UNINSTALL??
doc.text: I marked my Wifi as a 'Mobile Hotspot' so that, not much background data happens in silent, plus my isp/telco requires additional pseudo-login. Apparently Whatsapp don't like that, and always popping up asking me to 'forget' network. What's up with that? Now that Line, WeChat, Kakao already better, more features and free, I guess it's time to move on. Come on, free for iOS but charge Android users? I can pay but I'm guessing lots of others (my peers are 95% droids) won't or can't, so no point for me to pay.
